appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Administrative records of department offering interdisciplinary programs on the history, culture and development of Latin America and Caribbean nations and their relations between themselves and the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Administrative records of the Department of Latin American, Caribbean, and US Latino Studies (LACS). Includes enrollment records, self studies, College of Arts & Sciences (CAS) Dean correspondence, records of grants and other department initiatives, compact planning records, department executive committee records and minutes, department planning reports and self-studies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Most of the collection is in alphabetical order as maintained by the department. Some legal sized files were moved to Box 6 during transfer.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Records were primarily managed by department administrator Librada Pimentel. All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives in September 2021.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Department of Latin American, Caribbean, and US Latino Studies (LACS) offers interdisciplinary programs on the history, culture and development of Latin America and Caribbean nations, as well as the relations between these nations and the United States. LACS courses explore the interdependence between resident Latinx and immigrant populations in the United States and their countries of origin. Issues of race, gender, ethnicity and class are central to the curriculum.
